website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF 100mm f/2.8 Macro USM may not be the company's top of the line macro lens, but it does capture sharp images with 1:1 magnification.

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a real photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this lens and camera (Canon T6) for about 18 hours now. OMG! Forty five years old and I feel like a child that just got their first bike. This is amazing! How did I not find photography years ago?!? I’ve used this lens for closeup product shots and portraits at a distance. It’s beatiful no matter what I point it at. Now I think I’ll spend sometime reading how to take good photos that people will want to view. Orrrr.... just continue mashing that shutter button. That’s more fun right now. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Items condition not accurate — be careful when buying used.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this used and it was supposed to be in “very good” condition. Definitely wouldn’t consider that to be the case here. The main ring is loose and the lens looks like it has had a lot of use. The listing claimed it came with both the front and rear caps, which it did. However, the front lens cap is not the original lens cap, which was also not stated. It is some odd brand cap. Very disappointed— we have purchased used lenses previously and never had these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: What a great lens. You will not be disappointed. I shoot using a Canon 100D (SL1) camera, Canon 550EX flash and the wireless Metz Mecablitz 15 MS-1 Macro Ringlight which is controlled by the Canon 550EX flash. The camera is set in manual mode, shutter speed I keep at 1/200 and I use F16 at ISO 100 and so far the images I'm getting are pretty good and sharp. All without a tripod since the shutter speed is higher than the focal length of the lens, effectively 160mm on an APS-C sensor. This lens deserves the Red Ring.
customer_reviews.author: The Buddhist Witch

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: I love many things about this product. Of course, it is a Cannon!! Great close up photos of anything. Great details are captured. The only thing I dont like is that in order to take close ups, you actually cannot be too close to the subject. You need to keep your distance and let the camera focus on the specific area/subject and then take the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Nedelka Martinsen Pitti

customer_reviews.title: One of the top lens... period!
customer_reviews.text: This is my goto lens. It is also my favorite. As a photographer that shoots frequently the this lens has three main features I want in any lens. 1. Sharpness 2. Weight 3.Size. The sharpness is unbeatable 10/10, The weight is just right for use without a monopod, and the size is perfect, I don't like standing out if I go to a event and want some pics. I would suggest you get a hood for this. Another strong point of this lens is the bokeh which looks great in my portraits. The next lenses I like are $1500 and above so you can't beat this price for the quality. Attached is one of my portraits. Zabu | zabu@modelsensation.com
customer_reviews.author: Zabu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This lens does not have image stabilization which accounts for its very reasonable price, however the quality is first rate. We use this lens with a Canon 6D and, as is normal for macro work, mount it on a tripod so the lack of image stabilization is not an issue. We have taken around 500 shots with this lens and can vouch for low distortion and chromatic aberration (although the camera has built in compensation). Pictures are very sharp and the MTF seems to be a close match for the camera sensor. Thoroughly recommended as a budget buy for a high quality 100mm reasonable fast Macro lens.
customer_reviews.author: PMJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The EF 100mm Macro is a terrific lens, both mechanically and optically
customer_reviews.text: The EF 100mm Macro is a terrific lens, both mechanically and optically, This is the third version I have purchased having sold this lens twice before to finance other lenses. I always have regretted being without this lens after selling it. Whether Im taking jewelry details during a wedding prep shoot or flowers or insects this is a fantastic performer. Also a great portrait len! Every lens should work as well...don't hesitate to purchase this fun to use and versatile lens.
customer_reviews.author: J. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer, meaning that I don't make money from my hobby. So I couldn't see spending the money on the 100mm L series so I purchased the less expensive 100mm macro lens. Macro is one of my favorite photography genres and it is the main one I use when out in the field. So far this lens has not let me down. It is so clear. Now again, I'm not a professional but even I can compare sharpness when compared to the kit lens and the macro lens. There is so much difference! if you enjoy macro photography you will not be disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I am using it on my Canon T7i for macro shots of wildflows, mushrooms, and Mosses. I have only taken it out once but the lens produced fantastic macro shots and the build quality is great. So far, I have 0 complaints about this lens.
customer_reviews.author: michael k.

customer_reviews.title: My go to lens
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite plans for shooting small objects. Optical quality is excellent. My previous one had the diaphragm blades fail on me twice, but supposedly they have updated that mechanism in the newer versions of this, so hopefully this one will last longer
customer_reviews.author: B. Greenstone

customer_reviews.title: 1 macro this is a wonderful lens. Though some say it is heavy
customer_reviews.text: Use this on two film cameras the Canon 7NE and T2. With IS, USM, and 1:1 macro this is a wonderful lens. Though some say it is heavy, not too much as some zooms are this weight and much more. For many years I wanted a 1:1 macro, but instead used lens adaptors, with this being 1:1 it is used quite often. As with all IS type lens when placed on a tripod or other stable device do turn off IS. Yes, it is expensive, yet when you purchase it you should be quite pleased. It is not only used for macro photography it can be used for other types as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ric DonatoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 100 stars, great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful lens! For being used it is clean, very well kept & just like the picture/product description. They even sent a free lens cover! And the picture quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Haley C

customer_reviews.title: Working perfectly! EXCELLENT STATUS! Shipment and Delivery SUPER FAST!
customer_reviews.text: This Lens is awesome for Macro dental photography. It arrived SUPER EARLIER than what was supposed to. And it came in PERFECT STATUS, PERFECT PACKAGE! It is somehow Used, but to me IT'S CONPLETELY NEW! TOTALLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens, who needs an "L"?
customer_reviews.text: If I were to take a picture with this lens and then an identical picture with the "L" version of this lens and you were able to tell me what the difference is, I would seriously give you $100. Good luck. This lens is unbelievably sharp. It's like looking through a microscope. You may want to consider a set of Kenko extention tubes once you buy this, though. You'll just want to get closer and closer once you experiment with this lens. Side note, don't forget about this lens' wonderful ability to take portrait shots. Fantastic lens!
customer_reviews.author: photo Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with EF100mm
customer_reviews.text: This lens has worked great on my Canon 7D, it has producted sharp pictures. Whencompared with the rented Canon L series Len, this is obviously not a top of the line lens. However as someone who only takes pictures as a hobby, I can only complain when I am trying to impress friends with my photographic knownledge. When I am trying to find a reason to be critical I notice a little chromatic aberration in some pictures. There are a lot more versatile lens however I am very happy with this lens and recommend it to anyone looking for a Macro.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, versatile lens!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to serve as a macro lens, but have been very surprised by its versatility on a full-frame body. While it may be a little tight on a crop sensor, I have found that this lens produces beautiful images ranging from macros to portraits on my 5D Mark III. Focus is fast, colors are vibrant, and the bokeh is very smooth. I feel that the quality of this lens far exceeds its price, and it is an outstanding addition to my collection of lenses.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: A part of my standard kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens 4.5 years ago and am still surprised by how crispness of my macro and portrait pictures. The background of the pictures is also nice and smooth, which makes the people or foreground objects in macros really pop. The contrast of pictures taken with this lens is also impressive. Over the years with different cameras systems I've owned I seem to gravitate towards the same basic kit to start out with: 50mm, 100mm macro and a super wide angle lens. I find this is what I shoot with a lot of the time and I'm glad I picked this lens to be in that collection as it has served me well over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING lens! The images are really sharp, and the 100mm allows you to be a little further back from your subject and not right up on it (which is great for insects!) It also works well as a portrait lens, super clear and sharp, however you have to be set back a ways from your subject to get a good shot (because the lens is so close up). But still, I've used this for true macro photography and some event/portrait photography and its really great! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: First I would like to say this is my most expensive lens I have bought to date. When I placed this lens on my camera the sound of the focus was so smooth. I could not believe how smooth it sounded. My other lens seems so clunky to this lens. After the initial shock on how beautifully it sounded I decided to take some shots with it. I am not technical, but the glass on this lens puts out extremely beautiful images. This lens is by far way better then my tamron. I really don't have any cons. I really am amazed at this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I've used this and the 100 F2.8 L series macro and this is as sharp under most circumstances at half the cost. The L series offers image stabilization (IS) and while I don't see that as a macro issue, these lenses are GREAT for portraiture and general use. So, if you plan to do that sort of thing (and are not always on a tripod) and especially if you love sunset landscapes or candid portraits the IS might throw you to the L series. If not, this is your lens!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Liberman

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular optics!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this lens for not quite a year now and this is one of the sharpest lenses in the Canon lineup. I just posted some pics of a pair of newborn robins I shot hand held and they are super sharp even cropped at 100%. I recently purchased the 135 f/2.0 L and while it does have better bokeh than the 100 it is not sharper in decent light. I now have my eye on the ring lite, although using the 430ex or the on board flash of my 30D works well, I think I will get better results with the ring flash. I give this lens a big thumbs up, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of flower photos. I get great detail with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Z.

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to buy a secondhand lens but this works perfectly! So glad I gave this company a try. Loving my new lens. ❤
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lynn

customer_reviews.title: first macro lens
customer_reviews.text: This is my first macro lens, so I'm still getting to know it. I love the fact that it's a sharp walk-around lens as well as a macro. It's helpful to encourage me to "zoom with my feet" instead of with a lens. For real macro shots, it is necessary to use a tripod, but I've enjoyed hand-holding it to get some fuzzy close ups of spring flowers. I look forward to learning more about macro shooting, and this seems to be a terrific lens to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bloody well love this lens to death
customer_reviews.text: I bloody well love this lens to death. But that's because it hits the sweet spot for the kind of portraiture/beauty and macro work I do. It's a fast, crisp lens that's very versatile, if you know what you are doing. Getting focus when you're between the macro and regular zones can be a bit of a bear, but it's just a matter of leaning in and out a little for the lens to spin in for the focus on the zone you want.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wessel

customer_reviews.title: A Graphic Designer's Perspective On This Macro Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have lens for graphic designers delving into photography. Having the right lenses and equipment completely transformed my creative process. I shopped around for about a year looking for the right macro lens. I did test shots with various macro lenses in my price range at camera stores. I rented this one and eventually I bought it from Amazon because they had the best price. The lens has exceeded my expectations. It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Hamburgevons

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought the used lens and it was in perfect conditions. It works perfectly and I get amazing photos. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Had this lens for a number of months - really great. This is not a heavy neck breaker. It is super fast to focus and the sharpest of all my Canon's - even better then the 85mm L. Have done some shockingly good flower work and also been amused by what you can get with insects that I had never seen before. Highly recommended and I consider cheap for the quality and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent macro lens
customer_reviews.text: I am a pro commercial photographer. I use this for small products. Results are very acceptable. Couldn't justify cost of "L" glass.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was always interested in minute objects so this is the lens for me. This is one lens u can have fun with. But at start its very difficult to get the DOF right. it has a VERY shallow DOF when photographing really small objects as at 1-2x n that makes it very difficult to handle and get right part on focus. But with the learning curve I am now able to get it right. The pics are very sharp n life like. Portrait is also very nice n superb bokeh. Best piece of glass I have. Highly recommended if u love photographying small flowers & insects.
customer_reviews.author: AbhishekB

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens... my first macro lens. It has amazing quality and shows every tiny detail. I use this lens when photographing newborns, and have also snapped a few pictures of bugs and things as well!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for all sorts of photography
customer_reviews.text: This is an engineered "macro lens." One of the best of that type I've ever seen or used. In addition it makes a dandy prime portrait or light telephoto on smaller sensor cameras like the Canon T2. One the Canon D6 is fills the frame with sharp to the edge image. Rapidly becoming my 2nd favorite lens behind the 24-70L lens.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: A surprise "like"!
customer_reviews.text: While this lens was actually purchased as a gift for my daughter, I have seen the results of her initial work with it. I am truly surprised at the versatility of the device. It seems able to focus from a few millimeters to virtual infinity easily, quickly and the photos taken at various distances are outstanding. Although the lens was classed as used, it looked and functioned as though it were brand new. It interfaced to the EOS digital camera as fully as it does to my EOS film camera. I'd recommend the vendor without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: EV1Driver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for macro, great for portraits if you are far enough away
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to lens. I am an avid nature photographer and this lens is amazing for macro shots, but its also great for portraits. In the field I rarely use a tripod and the depth of field can be a little shallow when the light isn't bright enough to use a large aperture (small hole, large number). At home I've done a lot of macro shots with a tripod, and you can get amazing focus over your entire subject using F22 (or higher). The lens also makes a great mid range portrait lens, sharp faces and blown out backgrounds with nice bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: chamberlain fortin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful results with this lens!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for my wedding photos of details: rings flowers, programs and more. Creates beautiful shots that are sharp and the bokeh is phenomenal! I don't shoot macro shots of bugs and other small stuff but if I ever decide to.....I have the lens for it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sharpness
customer_reviews.text: While not the higher grade macro offered by Canon, it shoots images just as sharp. I've used it with inexpensive extension tubes as well with excellent results. Since I use it exclusively for macro, I never use AF.
customer_reviews.author: p47dude

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp lens.
customer_reviews.text: My son, a professional nature photographer, says it is the sharpest lens in his kit even though it is not an "L" series lens. I have been testing mine and it seems to be as sharp as my best lenses none of which are "L" series. Since I wrote this review, I have discovered that due to shoddy packing the lens is actually damaged. The rear element got jarred loose and now dust has gotten in and is showing up on the images. I don't know what to do about it. I have stopped using the lens because of this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schnepf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, perfect condition!
customer_reviews.text: Was in perfect conditions. Thank you so much! Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Mesen

customer_reviews.title: Great 100mm lens!!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is an incredibly good deal. The L series version of this lens costs twice as much and the difference to the naked eye in the general picture quality is almost the same. Yes the L series is heavier, feels sturdier and focuses faster. However, as mentioned at first, for the price you really can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: ZakAttack

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one used and it looked absolutely perfect when I got it. A year later and it's still working great. Best business investment I've ever made. It's great to not be so close to a subject that I'm blocking the light source, and I get great quality photos as well. I attached a few photos I shot with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome. I'm attaching a picture of a bug whom ...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this lens by second hand, with afraid of being damaged. Not only the lens came in a pristine condition, but also it came with caps and UV filter. Let me tell you something about this lens. It is awesome. I'm attaching a picture of a bug whom I took a picture.
customer_reviews.author: David Wong

customer_reviews.title: cANON EF Macro lens review
customer_reviews.text: The lens is superb. The pictures are clear, sharp and colors are true. I don"t have to get close to the subject to get any Macro shots. You won't be sorry if you buy it. Mind you, there is not IS with this lens. If you want that, you'll have to shell out another $400.00.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Good For Portraits, Macro Photography (obviously)
customer_reviews.text: Really shallow depth of field on this one. Awesome for portraits but you need to back up quite a bit to get the right range. Really crisp detail, more than any other lens i own. You can see the pores on someones face. Of course a macro lens is meant for macro photography, but this one is useful for a lot more. My second favorite lens to my 50mm 1.4f. Go ahead and buy it, unless you own a ridiculously small studio in which case you might be a bit cramped for space.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to any Photographers Bag
customer_reviews.text: Macro opens a whole new world to photographers. It gives a different and fresh set of challenges for any photographer. This lens is crisp and operates smoothly. Be sure to use a tripod or bean bag to keep your image stable. Personally I use a gorillapod to get the perfect distance. This is a fixed lens. You will not be able to zoom on a subject. Happy shooting!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Wow great flower pollen detail
customer_reviews.text: Playing around with my new 5D Mark IV with my old lenses. Wow great flower pollen detail. I was considering upgrading to L lenses but if tripod handy there is no beating this lens for close up work.
customer_reviews.author: Frank002

customer_reviews.title: Having fun with Macro
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It takes incredible pictures of my flowers and the critters that visit them. I was told that it would probably only work with a tripod but I have been able to get some pretty amazing pictures without one. I am using it on an entry level Canon so I can only imagine what I would get if I had a nice camera!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Schroden

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love macro photography and each time Im outdoors I have to have this lens or I'll see something and I'll regret that i didnt have my macro with me. Auto focus works good, manual focus works good, you can get as close as down to maybe 20cms it will still focus. Mybe The only thing its missing is the IS technology
customer_reviews.author: FatosYox

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Not just for portraits and up close macros, this is a very functional lens. I have a friend teaching me about cameras and photography, and this is what he recommended, and he demonstrated to me what it can do, and it's great. Now I just need to learn to do more with it myself! ; >)
customer_reviews.author: Elder Statesman Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Great starter macro lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I wish I would have purchased it with image stabilization. Being so long & heavy, there is quite a bit of camera shake when handheld. But, if you don't have the extra $500 to spend then it's a great piece of equipment. There should be no issues with using it on a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that this could be an L lens! It is crisp, clean, clear, and has amazing bokeh. I use this as a portrait lens and couldn't be happier. The colors are amazing and I am constantly surprised by the quality of this lens. Definitely a great piece to have in your lens collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best Lens I own!
customer_reviews.text: Canon makes the BEST lens I have ever bought. This one is small, quiet, and easy to use. The pictures are lovely and just what I wanted. Other manufacturers make good lens and I own several that are very nice products but this is the best in an affordable lens for the non-professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Pat in So. Ore.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a macro lens for quite some time now, and I'm so very glad I use this one! I do lots of wedding photography and this lens is all around wonderful! I use it for those close up detail shots, and even use it as a fixed lens at the reception. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Rea

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, sharp
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, sharp, fast glass, beautiful bokeh. I've only used it for macro work thus far, but I look forward to using it for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz K.

customer_reviews.title: What a great Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Image from this lens is superior, deep and field come incredible and very sharp pictures. The macro allow you to take very small objects...almost every picture I take with this lens come out as high quality wallpaper. It's a little bulky but this is what you can expect considering the optics involved. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Josetron

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: After using a zoom lens with macro feature built in a decided to make the jump to a dedicated macro lens and I'm really glad I did. Canon doesn't disappoint with this one. Lens takes nice sharp photos and was easy to get used to. You can't go wrong with Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF 100mm f/2.8 Macro USM Lens Well Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: This is my first macro lens so I don't really have anything else to compare to. Regardless, it has been wonderful to use. I have been taking many pictures of plants, flowers, and bugs and getting some beautiful shots. The colors are crisp and the images clear. The only drawback I can think of is its weight in relation to the Canon Rebel body. The lens is made mostly of metal while the Rebel's body is made mostly of plastic. Because of this it seemed a bit awkward to fit the lens onto the camera body at first. All of that set aside, I would highly recommend this lens to anybody who is working with a limited budget.
customer_reviews.author: Isle of Arran

customer_reviews.title: Amazing multi-purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: I have had this lens for over a year, and It is the best I have ever used, it's very fast and 100mm allows you to use it for many things, not just for macro. It works great for high DOF portraits and headshots, I also use it for product shots and of course, for macro close-ups. It excells in every field. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Diego D. Zaks B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a must-have. The macro shots are absolutely amazing. The lens has so many other uses that makes it multi functional. I'm not experienced enough to list all of the gory details that some of the reviewers do but they can take care of that. From a semi intermediate user I can tell you that the shots I produce using the lens are absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Turzanski

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous lens for Canon with Macro
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my favorite lens of all time. the speed, the 100 mm but with macro makes it nearly a zoom. It is heavy but in the scheme of durable lenses, not that bad. Macro is sharp, lens so fast. Wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great lens at a great price. I bought it used, but whoever owned it took great care and it's basically like new for a fraction of the price. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: A sharp and colorful rock
customer_reviews.text: The first macro lens I got and excellent first choice. This lens is sharp, REALLY fast and has a superb construction quality. Great option for those who don't have more money. I'm using it in almost all my wedding shoots, to get that romantic look of the couple dance without being intrusive. f2.8 rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Lavalle

customer_reviews.title: great macro lens
customer_reviews.text: I was told I didn't necessarily need the L serious version, and I'm happy I bought this. It gets really close to the subject, wish i could of taken the pics a little further away, that way some of the critters won't get scared and fly away.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G. Saint-elie

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, very sharp, love it
customer_reviews.text: I adore this lens. The photos are great if I can hold it still enough. My tripod broke so as soon as I get a new one I can't wait to use this lens even more! I'm very happy with my purchase, Takes great portraits as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: K. Webb

customer_reviews.title: This 100 f/2.8 works fine and it costs are reasonable!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful lens! I re-purchased this lens after selling it to upgrade to the 100 MK II IS. The cost difference and average reviews of the newer upgrade didn't merit another $600. This 100 f/2.8 works fine and it costs are reasonable!
customer_reviews.author: WTF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens for Macro and Portrait Work
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for macro photos or portraits. I read the other reviews and they influenced by purchase - no regrets. I do miss image stabilization, but the difference in price points is too great. I'll just need to hold more steady :)
customer_reviews.author: sr1sws

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding lens!
customer_reviews.text: I have done many focus and DOF tests. In every case, I was happy with the results. This is a real macro lens and offers outstanding sharpness. It is well built and a little heavy, which it should be. My only complaint is the type of UV filter and hood I purchased. Look at those carefully before purchasing. I still give the lens 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dianda

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I am working on some close up scientific photography so I use the 100 mm macro lens almost exclusively. It allows exquisite close up photography that is (finally!) in focus at most points of my three dimensional subjects. This camera and this lens are a blessing and I couldn't complete my project in a high quality manner without them!
customer_reviews.author: KarenH

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Clear, and Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Like all Canon lenses, the optical quality is wonderful. This lens has two settings, one for getting close, and one for getting even closer! product_meta.title: Canon EF 100mm f/2.8 Macro USM Fixed Lens for Canon SLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Style:Lens OnlyCANON 100MM F/2.8 MACRO USM EF From the Manufacturer: Bring small things into full-sized view with the Canon EF 100mm macro USM lens. Macro lenses can uncover detail that would be impossible to detect by the eye and give new perspective to extremely minute subjects such as insects or the petals of a small flower, and this lens is no exception. The lens offers such features as a three-group floating system for exceptional close-up performance; a secondary diaphragm that blocks stray light at f/2.8, which increases contrast when shooting wide open; a ultra-sonic monitor (USM) that provides outstanding autofocusing speed at all focusing distances; a wide manual focusing ring with smooth action; and full-time manual focus even in AF mode. The first lens in its class to feature inner focusing, the lens carries a one-year warranty.
